name: RufasSok

screenshots.caption: One level from one family of puzzles.

short_description:
This is a minimalist version of the Sokoban puzzle game.  It uses puzzle data in a text format that is easily found in collections on the internet, although often requiring a bit of editting.

The beauty of this implementation is that it is fully OpenGL 3.3 core profile C++ code, using no OpenGL-deprecated functions.

Has undo (u) and restart (r) functions.  Each data file has many "levels".  The next (n) and previous (p) keys move between levels.  The (R-shft) and (L-shft) keys move between puzzle data files.  Bigger (b) and smaller (s) keys help you to proportionally adjust the size of the window.  ReZero (z) creates a setpoint so that (r) will later restore that setpoint.

To move the blue "pusher" use the arrow keys.  The objective is to push all the red squares onto the green squares.

Comes with dozens of families of puzzles, each family having dozens of levels.
summary: Sokoban with many families of puzzles provided.
